meanings.definition: The way in which a musician applies their mouth to a wind instrument.
meanings.sent1: She practiced her embouchures diligently to improve her flute playing.
meanings.sent2: The clarinet player's embouchures were flawless during the performance.
meanings.sent3: His embouchures were so exaggerated that he accidentally made funny sounds on the saxophone.
meanings.sent4: The trumpet player's embouchures were like a key that unlocked beautiful melodies.
meanings.sent5: The teacher demonstrated proper embouchures by showing how to position the lips and jaw.

meanings.definition: The opening of a wind instrument into which the player blows.
meanings.sent1: The size of the embouchures on different flutes can affect the sound produced.
meanings.sent2: He carefully cleaned the embouchures of his trumpet after each practice session.
meanings.sent3: The band members joked about who had the biggest embouchures on their instruments.
meanings.sent4: The embouchures of the French horn gleamed under the stage lights.
meanings.sent5: The music store offered a variety of embouchures for sale to fit different instruments.
